newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait to back OPEC rollover if all members agree.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait to back OPEC rollover if all members agree.

text.p: Kuwait's Oil Minister said his country would back a rollover of OPEC's current production ceiling if all the other 10 members backed the measure, the official Kuwait News Agency reported on Tuesday.

"The only option would be to accept a rollover of the (current OPEC production) ceiling if all member countries agreed on that," Isa al-Mazeedi told the agency before leaving for Vienna, where the producer group is due to hold its bi-annual meeting on Wednesday.
Mazeedi said "oil prices are low at present," and added that Kuwait wanted to pervent them from "deteriorating."

"Continuing with the current production ceiling depends on the report that would be submitted by (OPEC's) secretary-general during the meeting and that is to be presented by the head of the committee that follows price (developments)," he added.
"He (Mazeedi) expressed hope that the results would be positive in the light of the informationation that would be presented," the agency said without elaboration.
Mazeedi expected oil prices to improve during the third quarter of 1997 due to a possible decline in global stocks, which had reached high levels, KUNA said.

Kuwait, which has a production quota of two million barrels per day (bpd), has often said it would seek a larger quota when OPEC decides to increase its self-imposed output ceiling set at 25.03 million bpd.
Kuwait puts its production capacity at 2.5 million bpd.
